intro: Jussiaea suffruticosa, commonly known as the coastal bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils near the shoreline. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that are arranged in clusters, and it has small, succulent leaves that help it retain water in its arid habitat. Jussiaea suffruticosa is adapted to saline and wind-swept environments, making it a hardy species found in coastal dunes and salt marshes. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important component of coastal plant communities.
